se.jguru.nazgul.core.parser.api

Interface TokenParser

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultTokenParser

    public interface TokenParser
    Specification for a Parser that recognizes String tokens, and offers substituting values for the token placeholders. The substitution is delegated to an extensible set of ParserAgents, to simplify complex substitution policies.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAgent(ParserAgent parserAgent)
      Adds a parserAgent to the list of known AbstractParserAgents.
      void initialize(TokenDefinitions tokenDefinitions)
      Initializes this TokenParser, indicating that the supplied TokenDefinitions should be used to acquire charSequences for start and end of tokens, as well as a pattern to recognize a Token.
      String substituteTokens(String data)
      Replaces the tokens found within the data.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(TokenDefinitions tokenDefinitions)
         throws IllegalStateException
        Initializes this TokenParser, indicating that the supplied TokenDefinitions should be used to acquire charSequences for start and end of tokens, as well as a pattern to recognize a Token. This initialize method can only be called once, before any call to the substituteTokens method has been done.
        Parameters:
        tokenDefinitions - a non-null TokenDefinitions object.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this TokenParser has already been initialized.

      • addAgent

        void addAgent(ParserAgent parserAgent)
       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a parserAgent to the list of known AbstractParserAgents.
        Parameters:
        parserAgent - the parserAgent to add.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parserAgent argument was null.

      • substituteTokens

        String substituteTokens(String data)
        Replaces the tokens found within the data.
        Parameters:
        data - The data in which to replace existing tokens.
        Returns:
        The token-substituted data.
